javadoc: Interface to define an instruction for a processor.

methods.javadoc: Get the prototype for this instruction.
methods.name: getPrototype
methods.comment: Get the prototype for this instruction.

methods.name: getRegister
methods.comment: If operand is a pure Register, return the register.

return.comment: A register if the operand represents a register.

methods.javadoc:
Get objects used by this operand (Address, Scalar, Register ...)
@param opIndex index of the operand.
methods.name: getOpObjects
methods.comment: Get objects used by this operand (Address, Scalar, Register ...)

methods.name: getInputObjects
methods.comment:
Get the Input objects used by this instruction.
 These could be Scalars, Registers, Addresses

return.comment: an array of objects that are used by this instruction

methods.name: getResultObjects
methods.comment:
Get the Result objects produced/affected by this instruction
 These would probably only be Register or Address

return.comment: an array of objects that are affected by this instruction

methods.name: getDefaultOperandRepresentation
methods.comment: Get the operand representation for the given operand index without markup.

methods.name: getDefaultOperandRepresentationList
methods.comment:
Get the operand representation for the given operand index.
 A list of Register, Address, Scalar, Character and String objects is returned - without markup!

return.comment: ArrayList of pieces of the operand representation.  Unsupported languages may return null.

methods.name: getSeparator
methods.comment:
Get the separator strings between an operand.
 
 The separator string for 0 are the characters before the first operand.
 The separator string for numOperands+1 are the characters after the last operand.

return.comment: separator string, or null if there is no string

methods.name: getOperandType
methods.comment: Get the type of a specific operand.

params.name: opIndex
params.comment: the index of the operand. (zero based)

methods.javadoc:
Get the operand reference type for the given operand index.
@param index operand index
methods.name: getOperandRefType
methods.comment: Get the operand reference type for the given operand index.

methods.javadoc:
Get default fall-through offset in bytes from start of instruction to the
 fallthrough instruction.  This accounts for any
 instructions contained with delay slots.
@return default fall-through offset or zero (0) if instruction has no fallthrough
methods.name: getDefaultFallThroughOffset
methods.comment:
Get default fall-through offset in bytes from start of instruction to the
 fallthrough instruction.  This accounts for any
 instructions contained with delay slots.

return.comment: default fall-through offset or zero (0) if instruction has no fallthrough

methods.name: getDefaultFallThrough
methods.comment:
Get the default fallthrough for this instruction.
 This accounts for any instructions contained with delay slots.

return.comment: fall-through address or null if instruction has no default fallthrough

methods.name: getFallThrough
methods.comment:
Get the fallthrough for this instruction, factoring in
 any fallthrough override and delay slotted instructions.

return.comment: fall-through address or null if instruction has no fallthrough

methods.javadoc:
Get the Address for the instruction that fell through to
 this instruction.
 This is useful for handling instructions that are found
 in a delay slot.
methods.name: getFallFrom
methods.comment:
Get the Address for the instruction that fell through to
 this instruction.
 This is useful for handling instructions that are found
 in a delay slot.

methods.javadoc:
Get an array of Address objects for all flows other than
 a fall-through.  This will include any flow references which
 have been added to the instruction.
@return flow addresses or null if there are no flows
methods.name: getFlows
methods.comment:
Get an array of Address objects for all flows other than
 a fall-through.  This will include any flow references which
 have been added to the instruction.

return.comment: flow addresses or null if there are no flows

methods.name: getDefaultFlows
methods.comment:
Get an array of Address objects for all default flows established
 by the underlying instruction prototype.  References are ignored.

return.comment: flow addresses or null if there are no flows

methods.javadoc:
Get the flow type of this instruction (how this
 instruction flows to the next instruction).
methods.name: getFlowType
methods.comment:
Get the flow type of this instruction (how this
 instruction flows to the next instruction).

methods.javadoc: Returns true if this instruction has no execution flow other than fall-through.
methods.name: isFallthrough
methods.comment: Returns true if this instruction has no execution flow other than fall-through.

methods.javadoc: Returns true if this instruction has a fall-through flow.
methods.name: hasFallthrough
methods.comment: Returns true if this instruction has a fall-through flow.

methods.javadoc: Returns the flow override which may have been set on this instruction.
methods.name: getFlowOverride
methods.comment: Returns the flow override which may have been set on this instruction.

methods.javadoc:
Set the flow override for this instruction.
@param flowOverride
methods.name: setFlowOverride
methods.comment: Set the flow override for this instruction.

methods.javadoc:
Get an array of PCode operations (micro code) that this instruction
 performs.  Flow overrides are not factored into pcode.
@return an array of Pcode operations,
         a zero length array if the language does not support PCode
methods.name: getPcode
methods.comment:
Get an array of PCode operations (micro code) that this instruction
 performs.  Flow overrides are not factored into pcode.

return.comment:
an array of Pcode operations,
         a zero length array if the language does not support PCode

methods.javadoc:
Get an array of PCode operations (micro code) that this instruction
 performs.  NOTE: If includeOverrides is true, unique temporary varnodes
 may be produced which vary in size to those produced for other instructions.
 If your analysis is sensitive to this you should consider using 
 {@link InstructionPrototype#getPcode(ghidra.program.model.mem.MemBuffer, ProcessorContext, FlowOverride, ghidra.program.model.address.UniqueAddressFactory)}
 instead with your own {@link UniqueAddressFactory} to prevent duplication within 
 your scope of analysis.
 by this method may not be suitable for use with certain analysis
@param includeOverrides if true any flow overrides will be factored
 into generated pcode.
@return an array of Pcode operations,
         a zero length array if the language does not support PCode
methods.name: getPcode
methods.comment:
Get an array of PCode operations (micro code) that this instruction
 performs.  NOTE: If includeOverrides is true, unique temporary varnodes
 may be produced which vary in size to those produced for other instructions.
 If your analysis is sensitive to this you should consider using 
 InstructionPrototype#getPcode(ghidra.program.model.mem.MemBuffer, ProcessorContext, FlowOverride, ghidra.program.model.address.UniqueAddressFactory)
 instead with your own UniqueAddressFactory to prevent duplication within 
 your scope of analysis.
 by this method may not be suitable for use with certain analysis

params.name: includeOverrides
params.comment:
if true any flow overrides will be factored
 into generated pcode.

return.comment:
an array of Pcode operations,
         a zero length array if the language does not support PCode

methods.name: getPcode
methods.comment:
Get an array of PCode operations (micro code) that a particular operand
 performs to compute its value.

params.name: opIndex
params.comment: index of the operand to retrieve PCode

return.comment:
an array of PCode operations,
         a zero length array if the language does not support PCode

methods.javadoc:
Get the number of delay slot instructions for this
 argument. This should be 0 for instructions which don't have a
 delay slot.  This is used to support the delay slots found on
 some RISC processors such as SPARC and the PA-RISC. This
 returns an integer instead of a boolean in case some other
 processor executes more than one instruction from a delay slot.
methods.name: getDelaySlotDepth
methods.comment:
Get the number of delay slot instructions for this
 argument. This should be 0 for instructions which don't have a
 delay slot.  This is used to support the delay slots found on
 some RISC processors such as SPARC and the PA-RISC. This
 returns an integer instead of a boolean in case some other
 processor executes more than one instruction from a delay slot.

methods.javadoc: Return true if this instruction was disassembled in a delay slot
methods.name: isInDelaySlot
methods.comment: Return true if this instruction was disassembled in a delay slot

methods.javadoc: Get the instruction following this one in address order.
methods.name: getNext
methods.comment: Get the instruction following this one in address order.

methods.javadoc: Get the instruction before this one in address order.
methods.name: getPrevious
methods.comment: Get the instruction before this one in address order.

methods.name: setFallThrough
methods.comment:
Overrides the instruction's default fallthrough address to the given address.
 The given address may be null to indicate that the instruction has no fallthrough.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address to be used as this instructions fallthrough address.  May be null.

methods.javadoc:
Restores this instruction's fallthrough address back to the default fallthrough
 for this instruction.
methods.name: clearFallThroughOverride
methods.comment:
Restores this instruction's fallthrough address back to the default fallthrough
 for this instruction.

methods.javadoc: Returns true if this instructions fallthrough has been overriden.
methods.name: isFallThroughOverridden
methods.comment: Returns true if this instructions fallthrough has been overriden.

methods.javadoc: @returns the instruction context for this instruction
methods.name: getInstructionContext

name: Instruction
comment: Interface to define an instruction for a processor.
